abilities.description: Allows the user to transform any part of their body into sharp steel blades, making them a 'Blade Human.' This grants both offensive cutting power and defensive hardness.
limitations: Exact limitations not yet revealed in this episode

keyMoments.title: Supa Supa no Mi User Debuts
keyMoments.description: Daz Bonez (Mr. 1), possessor of the Supa Supa no Mi, makes his first appearance with his metallic appearance hinting at his blade powers.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces a Devil Fruit that will later challenge Zoro to surpass his limits and learn to cut steel.

reveals.information: The Supa Supa no Mi exists and is possessed by Mr. 1

abilities.description: Allows the user to grow sharp, pointy spikes from any part of their body, which can be used for stabbing attacks and defense.
limitations: Exact limitations not yet revealed in this episode

keyMoments.title: Toge Toge no Mi User Debuts
keyMoments.description: Zala (Miss Doublefinger), possessor of the Toge Toge no Mi, appears at Spiders Café, though her spike abilities are not yet demonstrated.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces the Devil Fruit user who will later battle Nami.

reveals.information: The Toge Toge no Mi exists and is possessed by Miss Doublefinger

abilities.description: Allows the user to transform into a mole or mole-human hybrid, granting the ability to dig underground rapidly and move through the earth.
limitations: Exact limitations not yet revealed in this episode

keyMoments.title: Mogu Mogu no Mi User Debuts
keyMoments.description: Drophy (Miss Merry Christmas), possessor of the Mogu Mogu no Mi, appears at Spiders Café.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces a Zoan-type user who will later battle Usopp and Chopper.

reveals.information: The Mogu Mogu no Mi exists and is possessed by Miss Merry Christmas

name.japanese: イヌイヌの実 モデル「ダックスフント」
name.romanized: Inu Inu no Mi, Moderu: Dakkusufunto

abilities.description: An inanimate gun that has consumed this Devil Fruit, allowing it to transform into a dachshund or dachshund-gun hybrid. The gun can move and act independently while retaining its firearm capabilities.
limitations: Exact limitations not yet revealed in this episode

keyMoments.title: First Inanimate Object with Devil Fruit Revealed
keyMoments.description: Lassoo, a gun that has consumed the Inu Inu no Mi Model: Dachshund, debuts as Mr. 4's weapon, representing one of the first confirmed instances of an inanimate object possessing Devil Fruit powers.
keyMoments.significance: Expands the understanding of Devil Fruit mechanics, showing that inanimate objects can consume and use Devil Fruits through unknown means.

reveals.information: Inanimate objects can somehow consume Devil Fruits and gain their powers
Lassoo, Mr. 4's gun, has consumed the Inu Inu no Mi Model: Dachshund
